title: Lifeâ€™s Been Good
lyrics:
[Verse 1: Joe Walsh]
I have a mansion, forget the price
Ain't never been there, they tell me it's nice
I live in hotels, tear out the walls
I have accountants pay for it all
[Chorus: Joe Walsh]
They say I'm crazy, but I have a good time, yes I do
I'm just looking for clues at the scene of the crime
Life's been good to me so far
[Verse 2: Joe Walsh]
My Maserati does 185
I lost my license, now I don't drive
I have a limo, ride in the back
I lock the doors and watch the war in Iraq
[Verse 3: Joe Walsh]
I make hit records, my fans they can't wait
They write me letters, tell me Glenn's great
So I got me an office, gold records on the wall
Just leave a message, maybe I'll call
[Chorus:]
Lucky I'm sane after all I've been through
Everybody says, "I'm cool" (He's cool)
I can't complain, but sometimes I still do
Life's been good to me so far

[Instrumental Bridge]
[Verse 4: Joe Walsh]
I go to parties, sometimes until four
It's hard to leave when you can't find the door
(Come in)
Tough to handle this fortune and fame
Everybody's so damn different, we haven't changed
[Chorus:]
Oh, and sometimes I still cry
Everybody say, "Oh, yeah, yeah" (Oh, yeah)
Oh yeah
I keep on goin', guess I'll never know why
Life's been good to me so far
Yeah, yeah, yeah
Wow, wow
Ah, ah
[Outro:]
Oh yeah
Oh yeah
